Articles.Content: decrease fps in 100 to 50. Good work

Hello I have a very strange Problem here.

the mod works fine up to a little detail:

My Kerbin (when on ground) has no "daysky" anymore.

(The sky stays all day nearly black it turns at noon a bit darkblue but that is all)

I deinstalled the normal EVE Mod, and installed your 3 files. Any idea what can cause this?

*please delete this doublepost accidently)

 

Edited October 12, 2016 by Xentor

Just now, Xentor said:

Hello I have a very strange Problem here.

the mod works fine up to a little detail:

My Kerbin (when on ground) has no "daysky" anymore.

(The sky stays all day nearly black it turns at noon a bit darkblue but that is all)

I deinstalled the normal EVE Mod, and installed your 3 files. Any idea what can cause this?

 

No idea but logs wouldn't hurt. I might be able to help then

Here my Outputlog and 2 Screenshots.

The 1. Shows how Kerbin looks on the surface at bright day (normal)

The 2. shows Kerbal in the Mapdisplay and when outside Kerbals "Influencesphere"

https://www.dropbox.com/s/z8u5i8f15s39n8s/KSP Log%26Screenshots.zip?dl=0

Hi All. I am playing in Linux Debian 8.6 in 64 bits mode and the SVE pack makes the game unplayable due to memory leaks (it ate my 16Gb or ram in aprox 30 seconds) From the very start the game ran in  around 1 FPS.

Works great in windows by the way, but I love playing in Linux.

Keep on the good job

Z
It looks like it is this scatterer Mod. I guess.
FYI there is a dll rebuild in Scaterer's development forum that may fix some issues, replace the dll with the one you get from this pack

1 minute ago, Jiraiyah said:

FYI there is a dll rebuild in Scaterer's development forum that may fix some issues, replace the dll with the one you get from this pack

The fixed dll is included with this mod. 

This mod is just configs and textures.  So these problems likely are with EVE or Scatterer 

Edited October 12, 2016 by Galileo
oh didn't know that, thanks
This mod is awesome, thanks!
The error must be in your Scaterer files. I did overwrite them with the original now, and the problem is gone.

Looking at Scatterer's files, there's a ghost1.png, but not a Ghost1.png. Straight up removing Scatterer fixes all my problems, so this is definitely it.

Edit: Renaming ghost1, 2, and 3.png to Ghost1, 2, and 3.png solved all of my problems. Everything works great now.

Edited October 12, 2016 by Monchoman45

13 minutes ago, Xentor said:

The error must be in your Scaterer files. I did overwrite them with the original now, and the problem is gone.

Ok that's good. I am driving  so I can't look at your output log right now but if that's working for now that's good. Do note that my configs are customized to work well with my cloud textures. so it won't look right and neither will laythe.  You will likely experience some very Overexposed rings around those planets

1 hour ago, ezequielandrush said:

Hi All. I am playing in Linux Debian 8.6 in 64 bits mode and the SVE pack makes the game unplayable due to memory leaks (it ate my 16Gb or ram in aprox 30 seconds) From the very start the game ran in  around 1 FPS.

Works great in windows by the way, but I love playing in Linux.

Keep on the good job

Z

I would bring that on the scatterer and EVE thread.  This mod is just textures and cfgs and it wouldn't  cause a memory leak

Edited October 12, 2016 by Galileo

30 minutes ago, Monchoman45 said:

I'm having problems with Scatterer too, I get super low FPS just looking at KSC, and then a crash shortly thereafter. The bottom of my log looks like fun:

 

Looking at Scatterer's files, there's a ghost1.png, but not a Ghost1.png. Straight up removing Scatterer fixes all my problems, so this is definitely it.

Edit: Renaming ghost1, 2, and 3.png to Ghost1, 2, and 3.png solved all of my problems. Everything works great now.

Very strange that it works for me but its caps sensitive for you.. Either way ill upload fixed version in a few

21 minutes ago, Galileo said:

Very strange that it works for me but its caps sensitive for you.. Either way ill upload fixed version in a few

I'm on Linux, which has a case sensitive file system.

11 minutes ago, Monchoman45 said:

I'm on Linux, which has a case sensitive file system.

that makes ALOT of sense. i have not used linux in years so i dont remember such things. The fix is uploading now.       @Monchoman45 try it now

QUICK FIX

1.0.91
-Fixed an Issue with scatterer sunflare cfgs causing a drop in performance for some. (apparently Linux is a case sensitive OS)

**DO NOT INSTALL EVE SEPERATELY, EVERYTHING IS BUNDLED IN THIS DOWNLOAD**

 

Download Link

 

Edited October 12, 2016 by Galileo

36 minutes ago, Galileo said:

that makes ALOT of sense. i have not used linux in years so i dont remember such things. The fix is uploading now.       @Monchoman45 try it now

 

Tried but problem still exists, extracted this file and filenames were still all lower, i.e. ghost1.png, ghost2.png, instead of Ghost1.png

I think problem is that scatterer.dll references those files with the starting capital (i peeked inside the dll and files were named Ghost1.png, so .. )

So only solution is to rename those files

I understand most of the config here is a stylistic choice and not necessarily accurate but aren't the aurorae supposed to be brighter? In real life it's this bright...

 

I changed the value of minlight to 6 and it's a little closer to it: http://i.imgur.com/cEq645c.jpg

Also how do I make the radius of the aurora smaller?

2 minutes ago, SleweD said:

I understand most of the config here is a stylistic choice and not necessarily accurate but aren't the aurorae supposed to be brighter? In real life it's this bright...

 

I changed the value of minlight to 6 and it's a little closer to it: http://i.imgur.com/cEq645c.jpg

Also how do I make the radius of the aurora smaller?

you would have to edit it in Photoshop

I tried it at different levels like 3,4, and 5 and it doesnt look right to me on the surface.

Thanks for the quick reply! I suppose it's a matter of taste - it seems fine to me from the ground, that UV noise thing you've got going is masterful.

I'd also like to point out Jool is missing a bottom Aurora.

1 minute ago, SleweD said:

1 hour ago, SleweD said:

I understand most of the config here is a stylistic choice and not necessarily accurate but aren't the aurorae supposed to be brighter? In real life it's this bright...

 

I changed the value of minlight to 6 and it's a little closer to it: http://i.imgur.com/cEq645c.jpg

Also how do I make the radius of the aurora smaller?

You realize that's not a real photograph of Earth, right? It's not even possible to represent how dim the auroras really are without using HDR effects. In real life, for example, they're entirely invisible during the day, but notice that with EVE/SVE, they still show up. This is because they really should be much dimmer, and the night side should be so deeply black that they show up provided you don't have the glare of the day side in view.
